summary: The Security Council, recalling its previous resolutions and statements on the Democratic Republic of the Congo, reaffirms its commitment to the country's sovereignty, territorial integrity, and political independence. The Council notes that the situation in the Democratic Republic of the Congo continues to pose a threat to international peace and security in the region. Acting under Chapter VII of the Charter, the Council decides to extend the mandate and personnel strength of the United Nations Organization Mission in the Democratic Republic of the Congo (MONUC) until 15 May 2007, as previously set out in resolutions 1565 (2004), 1592 (2005), 1596 (2005), 1621 (2005), 1635 (2005), and 1736 (2006). The Council decides to remain actively seized of the matter.
